005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.impl.EmptyFlagContainer;
009
010import java.util.Map;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
014
015/**
016 * Provides support for managing the flag contents of a
017 * {@link IModelDefinition}.
018 * <p>
019 * This interface provides the underlying data used by
020 * {@link IFeatureContainerFlag}.
021 *
022 * @param <FI>
023 *          the Java type of the managed flag instance data
024 */
025public interface IContainerFlagSupport<FI extends IFlagInstance> {
026  /**
027   * Provides an empty instance.
028   *
029   * @param <T>
030   *          the Java type of the flag instances
031   * @return an empty instance
032   */
033  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
034  @NonNull
035  static <T extends IFlagInstance> IContainerFlagSupport<T> empty() {
036    return (IContainerFlagSupport<T>) EmptyFlagContainer.EMPTY;
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Create a new flag container without a JSON key.
041   *
042   * @param <T>
043   *          the Java type of the flag instances
044   * @return the flag container
045   */
046  @NonNull
047  static <T extends IFlagInstance> IFlagContainerBuilder<T> builder() {
048    return new FlagContainerBuilder<>(null);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Create a new flag container using the provided flag qualified name as the
053   * JSON key.
054   *
055   * @param <T>
056   *          the Java type of the flag instances
057   * @param jsonKey
058   *          the qualified name of the JSON key
059   * @return the flag container
060   */
061  @NonNull
062  static <T extends IFlagInstance> IFlagContainerBuilder<T> builder(@NonNull Integer jsonKey) {
063    return new FlagContainerBuilder<>(jsonKey);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Get a mapping of flag effective name to flag instance.
068   *
069   * @return the mapping of flag effective name to flag instance
070   */
071  @NonNull
072  Map<Integer, FI> getFlagInstanceMap();
073
074  /**
075   * Get the JSON key flag instance.
076   *
077   * @return the flag instance or {@code null} if no JSON key is configured
078   */
079  @Nullable
080  FI getJsonKeyFlagInstance();
081}
